Paragraphs.Text: Programming does not need to be complicated. It can be as easy as adding two and two. Try it out yourself.
Numbers without a decimal point are aoutomatically of the type Int32. You can retrive the type by calling the GetType() function. It works for everything in C#.
Another function that is available for everythin in C# is ToString. It creates a string representation of what it is called on.
Let us stay with whole numbers for a moment. The Integer data type contains 32 bits and can be noted as int or Int32.
The type can be stated explicitly by wrinting (int) or (Int32) in front of the number.

Title: Kickstart with the integer data type
